ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks
cookingMethod:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, oregano, thyme, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Add chicken and vegetables to the bowl and toss to coat. 
2. Thread the chicken and vegetables onto skewers. 
3. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill skewers for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through. 
4. Serve hot.
cookingMethod2:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 
2. Arrange eggplant slices in a single layer on a baking sheet and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 30 minutes. 
3. Rinse eggplant slices and pat dry. 
4. In a large skillet, cook ground lamb, onion, and garlic until lamb is browned and onions are tender. 
5. Add diced tomatoes, parsley, mint, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and pepper and simmer for 10-15 minutes. 
6. In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. 
7. Whisk in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, until mixture is bubbly. 
8. Gradually whisk in milk and cook, stirring constantly, until sauce has thickened. 
9. Remove from heat and whisk in beaten egg and Parmesan cheese. 
10. In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer eggplant slices and lamb mixture. 
11. Pour cheese sauce over the top. 
12. Bake for 45-50 minutes, until golden brown and bubbly. 
13. Let cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.
cookingMethod3:
1. In a medium bowl, combine bulgur wheat, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and black pepper. 
2. Let mixture sit for 30 minutes, until bulgur is softened. 
3. Add chopped parsley, mint, green onions, tomato, and cucumber to the bowl and toss to combine. 
4. Serve chilled.

cookingMethod:
1. In a large bowl, combine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese, and Kalamata olives. 
2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and black pepper. 
3. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat. 
4. Serve chilled.
cookingMethod2:
1. Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. 
2. In a large bowl, combine ground lamb, grated onion, minced garlic, dried oregano, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. 
3. Mix well with your hands and shape into 4 long patties. 
4. Grill patties for 4-5 minutes per side, until fully cooked. 
5. Warm pita breads on the grill for 1-2 minutes per side. 
6. To assemble gyros, spread tzatziki sauce on each pita bread. 
7. Top with a lamb patty, chopped tomato, sliced cucumber, and thinly sliced red onion. 
8. Roll up pita bread and serve immediately.
cookingMethod3:
1. In a large bowl, combine bulgur wheat and boiling water. 
2. Cover and let stand for 30 minutes, or until bulgur is tender and water is absorbed. 
3. In a small bowl, whisk together extra-virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. 
4. Add chopped parsley, chopped mint, chopped tomato, chopped cucumber, and finely chopped red onion to the bulgur. 
5. Pour dressing over the salad and toss to combine. 
6. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. 
7. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

cookingMethod:
1. In a large bowl, mix together ground lamb, breadcrumbs, parsley, mint, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper. 
2. Shape the mixture into small meatballs or oblong shapes. 
3. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the kofta and cook, turning occasionally, for 8-10 minutes, until browned on all sides and cooked through. 
4. Serve hot with tzatziki sauce.
cookingMethod2:
1. In a large bowl, combine bulgur wheat, boiling water, extra-virgin olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. 
2. Stir to combine, then cover and let sit for 30 minutes. 
3. After 30 minutes, fluff bulgur with a fork. 
4. Add chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh mint, diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, and diced red onion. 
5. Toss to combine. 
6. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. 
7. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. 
8. Serve cold or at room temperature.
ingredients3: 1 large pita bread, torn into bite-size pieces
cookingMethod3:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 
2. Toss torn pita bread with olive oil, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. 
3. Spread pita pieces out on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until crisp and golden brown. 
4. In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, chopped cucumber, chopped tomato, chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh mint, and chopped red onion. 
5. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, black pepper, and minced garlic. 
6. Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine. 
7. Add baked pita pieces to salad and toss again. 
8. Serve immediately.

recipeName: Grilled Swordfish with Lemon and Garlic
cookingMethod:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and black pepper. 
2. Place swordfish steaks in a shallow dish and pour marinade over the top. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. 
3. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill swordfish for 4-5 minutes per side, until cooked through. 
4. Serve hot with lemon wedges.
cookingMethod2:
1. In a large bowl, combine bulgur wheat, boiling water, extra-virgin olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. 
2. Stir to combine, then cover and let sit for 30 minutes. 
3. After 30 minutes, fluff bulgur with a fork. 
4. Add chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh mint, diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, and diced red onion. 
5. Toss to combine. 
6. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. 
7. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. 
8. Serve cold or at room temperature.
cookingMethod3:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F. 
2. Prick eggplants with a fork several times and place on a baking sheet. 
3. Roast eggplants in the oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are soft and the skin is charred. 
4. Let eggplants cool, then peel off the skin and discard. 
5. Place eggplant flesh in a food processor and pulse until smooth. 
6. Add minced garlic, tahini, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the food processor and pulse again until well combined.

cookingMethod:
1. Heat the falafel balls according to package instructions. 
2. Warm the flour tortilla in a dry skillet over medium heat. 
3. Spread hummus onto the tortilla, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges. 
4. Top with chopped lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and red onion. 
5. Drizzle tahini and lemon juice over the top. 
6. Place falafel balls on top of the vegetables. 
7. Fold the bottom of the tortilla up over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll up tightly. 
8. Serve immediately.
ingredients2: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
Chopped fresh parsley and paprika for garnish
cookingMethod2:
1. In a food processor, pulse chickpeas until they form a coarse meal. 
2. Add fresh lemon juice, tahini, minced garlic, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the food processor and pulse until well combined. 
3. With the food processor running, drizzle in extra-virgin olive oil until the hummus is smooth and creamy. 
4. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. 
5. Serve chilled or at room temperature, garnished with chopped fresh parsley and a sprinkle of paprika.
ingredients3: Chopped fresh parsley and paprika for garnish
cookingMethod3:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F. 
2. Cut eggplants in half lengthwise and place on a baking sheet. 
3. Roast eggplants in the preheated oven until soft and tender, about 40 minutes. 
4. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. 
5. Scoop the flesh out of the eggplants and transfer to a food processor. 
6. Add tahini, minced garlic, fresh lemon juice, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the food processor and pulse until smooth. 
7. With the food processor running, drizzle in the extra-virgin olive oil until the mixture is creamy and well combined. 
8. Transfer the baba ghanoush to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped fresh parsley and paprika. 
9. Serve with pita bread or fresh veggies.

cookingMethod:
1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 
2. Add onion and red bell pepper and sauté until tender, about 5-7 minutes. 
3. Add garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper and cook for an additional minute. 
4. Add diced tomatoes and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until sauce has thickened. 
5. Using a spoon, make 4-6 wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well. 
6. Season with salt and pepper and cover the skillet. Cook for 10-15 minutes, until the eggs are cooked to your liking. 
7. Sprinkle feta cheese and chopped parsley over the top. 
8. Serve hot with crusty bread.
ingredients2: 1 large pita bread, torn into bite-size pieces
cookingMethod2:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 
2. Toss torn pita bread with olive oil, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. 
3. Spread pita pieces out on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until crisp and golden brown. 
4. In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, chopped cucumber, chopped tomato, chopped fresh parsley, chopped fresh mint, and chopped red onion. 
5. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, black pepper, and minced garlic. 
6. Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine. 
7. Add baked pita pieces to salad and toss again. 
8. Serve immediately.
cookingMethod3:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F. 
2. Prick eggplants with a fork several times and place on a baking sheet. 
3. Roast eggplants in the oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are soft and the skin is charred. 
4. Let eggplants cool, then peel off the skin and discard. 
5. Place eggplant flesh in a food processor and pulse until smooth. 
6. Add minced garlic, tahini, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the food processor and pulse again until well combined. 
7. With the food processor running, drizzle in extra-virgin olive oil until the mixture is smooth and creamy. 
8. Serve at room temperature, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.
